card.name: Acid Rain
card.ability: Destroy all Forests.

card.name: Aesthir Glider
card.ability:
Flying
Aesthir Glider can't block.
card.flavor:
"Sacrilege! A noble ally in life, made nothing more than a glorified kite in death!"
—Arna Kennerüd, skycaptain

card.name: Air Elemental
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

card.name: Al-abara's Carpet
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by attacking creatures without flying.
card.flavor: Al-abara simply laughed and lifted one finger, and the carpet carried her high out of our reach.

card.name: Alaborn Musketeer
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: Muskets gave the Alaborn army an advantage it had long lacked—air defense.

card.name: Alaborn Trooper
card.flavor:
"I dedicate my body to my country
And my life to my King."
—Alaborn Soldier's Oath

card.name: Aladdin
card.ability: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Aladdin.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Aladdin's ability can take control of more than one artifact, although only one each time the ability is used.
8/1/2008 : You do not lose control of the permanent if it stops being an artifact. The validity of the target is checked only on announcement and resolution of the ability.

card.name: Alchor's Tomb
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target permanent you control becomes the color of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

card.name: Ali from Cairo
card.ability: Damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This effect does not apply to effects which reduce your life without doing damage.
10/4/2004 : The ability works up until Ali enters the graveyard, so if he takes lethal damage or is destroyed at the same time you take damage, the ability helps you. If the damage occurs after it goes to the graveyard, however, it is not affected by the Ali which is no longer on the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : This effect does not prevent damage, it prevents the damage from turning into loss of life. So the full damage is dealt (and abilities that trigger on damage being dealt still trigger), but the full loss of life is not applied.

card.name: Alluring Scent
card.ability: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
card.flavor: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

card.name: Amulet of Kroog
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing, greatly adding to the city's glory.

card.name: Angelic Voices
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1 as long as you control no nonartifact, nonwhite creatures.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You get the bonus if all of your creatures are white or artifact even if they also have other colors or qualities. So, if your only creature is a white and green creature, or a red artifact creature, you would get the bonus.

card.name: Animate Artifact
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
As long as enchanted artifact isn't a creature, it's an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : This card has been returned to its original functionality. If it is enchanting an artifact that's already a creature, it won't change its power and toughness.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Argivian Blacksmith
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target artifact creature this turn.
card.flavor: Through years of study and training, the Blacksmiths of Argive became adept at reassembling the mangled remains of the strange, mechanical creatures abounding in their native land.

card.name: Argothian Pixies
card.ability:
Argothian Pixies can't be blocked by artifact creatures.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Pixies by artifact creatures.

card.name: Argothian Treefolk
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Treefolk by artifact sources.

card.name: Armageddon
card.ability: Destroy all lands.
card.flavor:
"‘O miserable of happy! Is this the end
Of this new glorious world . . . ?'"
—John Milton, Paradise Lost

card.name: Armageddon Clock
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock.
At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player.
{4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Players can remove as many counters as they can pay for each turn.

card.name: Artifact Blast
card.ability: Counter target artifact spell.
card.flavor: The first line of defense against Urza and Mishra, the Artifact Blast achieved widespread fame until an unlucky mage discovered it was useless on the devices the brothers had already created.

card.name: Ashnod's Altar
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Add {2} to your mana pool.

card.name: Atog
card.ability: Sacrifice an artifact: Atog gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Badlands
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Land type changing effects that change a dual land's land type will remove the old land types completely. Text-changing effects that just change one of the two land types will leave the other type unaffected.
10/4/2004 : This card is a Mountain and a Swamp even while in the graveyard, library, or any other zone.
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Balance
card.ability: Each player chooses a number of lands he or she controls equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This spell is not targeted, so cards which can't be targeted, such as a creature with Protection from White, are both counted and valid choices for being sacrificed.
10/4/2004 : All cards sacrificed at one time go to the graveyard simultaneously. All cards discarded go to the graveyard simultaneously. As always, you pick the order they end up in the graveyard.
10/4/2004 : Cards are not counted until the appropriate step. So, a land creature sacrificed to the first part of the spell would not count for the last part.

card.name: Basalt Monolith
card.ability:
Basalt Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.
{3}: Untap Basalt Monolith.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can be untapped as often as you can pay for it.

card.name: Bayou
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Bee Sting
card.ability: Bee Sting deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
Busy as a bumblebee, blistered as a goblin.
—Alaborn saying

card.name: Bird Maiden
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor:
"Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart, A radiant brow and tresses that beguile And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile."
—The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

card.name: Black Knight
card.ability:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
card.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

card.name: Blaze of Glory
card.ability:
Cast Blaze of Glory only during combat before blockers are declared.
Target creature defending player controls can block any number of creatures this turn. It blocks each attacking creature this turn if able.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Does not allow a tapped creature to block, or allow a creature to block any creatures it would not normally be able to block.

card.name: Blue Elemental Blast
card.ability: Choose one — Counter target red spell; or destroy target red permanent.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.

card.name: Book of Rass
card.ability: {2}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't spend yourself to below zero life. You can't spend life you don't have.

card.name: Bottle of Suleiman
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you. If you win the flip, put a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The coin is flipped on resolution and not on declaration of the ability.

card.name: Braingeyser
card.ability: Target player draws X cards.

card.name: Brass Man
card.ability:
Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.
card.ruling: 5/1/2006 : Reworded so that it triggers only once at beginning of upkeep, instead of being an activated ability usable any time during your upkeep.  You can no longer make infinite combos with this ability.

card.name: Bronze Horse
card.ability:
Trample
As long as you control another creature, prevent all damage that would be dealt to Bronze Horse by spells that target it.

card.name: Candelabra of Tawnos
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Untap X target lands.
card.flavor: Tawnos learned quickly from Urza that utter simplicity often led to wondrous, yet subtle utility.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You may untap your opponent's lands if desired.
10/4/2004 : Can be used on an untapped land.
10/4/2004 : This is not mana ability. It is a normal ability and it will resolve along with other spells and abilities on the stack. The lands untap during resolution.

card.name: Celestial Sword
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"So great is its power, only the chosen can wield it and live."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

card.name: Champion Lancer
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
card.flavor: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.

card.name: Channel
card.ability: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {1} to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't pay life you don't have. In other words, you can't Channel yourself below zero life.

card.name: Citanul Druid
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts an artifact spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Citanul Druid.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : In multiplayer games it affects all players.

card.name: City of Brass
card.ability:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The damaging ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

card.name: Clay Statue
card.ability: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.
card.flavor: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

card.name: Clockwork Avian
card.ability:
Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
10/4/2004 : Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
10/4/2004 : If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

card.name: Clockwork Gnomes
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
card.flavor:
"Until I came to the Floating Isle, I never had to oil the servants."
—Baki, wizard attendant

card.name: Clockwork Swarm
card.ability:
Clockwork Swarm enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Swarm can't be blocked by Walls.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Swarm attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Swarm to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
10/4/2004 : Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
10/4/2004 : If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

card.name: Cloud Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
Cloud Dragon can block only creatures with flying.

card.name: Cloud Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Cloud Spirit can block only creatures with flying.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If it loses Flying, it will be unable to block any creatures.

card.name: Colossus of Sardia
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.
{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.flavor: Buried under a thin layer of dirt, it was known for centuries as Mount Sardia.
card.ruling: 5/1/2008 : The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

card.name: Control Magic
card.ability:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You take control of a creature, but Auras enchanting and Equipment attached to the creature do not change controller.

card.name: Conversion
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The Conversion effect is a continuous effect. There is no chance to tap a just-played mountain for red mana before it becomes a plains.
10/15/2006 : Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

card.name: Copy Artifact
card.ability: You may have Copy Artifact enter the battlefield as a copy of any artifact on the battlefield, except it's an enchantment in addition to its other types.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The copy is both an artifact and an enchantment, so it is an artifact-enchantment (perhaps even an artifact-creature-enchantment). It can be affected by anything which affects either type of permanent.
10/4/2004 : The copy of the artifact is not still blue. It copies the color of the thing it is copying.
10/4/2004 : The artifact to copy is chosen at the time this card enters the battlefield. If there is no valid artifact to choose, then this card enters the battlefield as an enchantment that has no effect.

card.name: Coral Helm
card.ability: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Counterspell
card.ability: Counter target spell.

card.name: Crumble
card.ability: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

card.name: Cyclone
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

card.name: Cyclopean Mummy
card.ability: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The Mummy does go to the graveyard and trigger abilities which watch for something going to the graveyard. It then gets exiled as a triggered ability.
10/4/2004 : It does not get exiled if it goes to the graveyard from someplace other than the battlefield. This includes discarding from your hand or if the spell is countered.

card.name: Cyclopean Tomb
card.ability:
{2}, {T}: Put a mire counter on target non-Swamp land. That land is a Swamp for as long as it has a mire counter on it. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
When Cyclopean Tomb is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game, remove all mire counters from a land that a mire counter was put onto with Cyclopean Tomb but that a mire counter has not been removed from with Cyclopean Tomb.
card.ruling:
10/15/2006 : Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.
8/1/2008 : After leaving the battlefield, the ability triggers during each of your upkeeps for the rest of the game. As it resolves, you must remove a mire counter from a land that had a mire counter put on it by that instance of Cyclopean Tomb, but it doesn't matter where the mire counter you remove came from. For instance, you could remove mire counters that were put on the land by Gilder Bairn.
8/1/2008 : The land remains a Swamp as long as it has a mire counter on it. This effect is not tied to the Tomb remaining on the battlefield.

card.name: Dakmor Plague
card.ability: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

card.name: Dark Ritual
card.ability: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Deathcoil Wurm
card.ability: You may have Deathcoil Wurm assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
card.ruling:
4/1/2008 : If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.
4/1/2008 : When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
4/1/2008 : You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
4/1/2008 : If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

card.name: Deathgrip
card.ability: {B}{B}: Counter target green spell.

card.name: Demonic Hordes
card.ability:
{T}: Destroy target land.
At the beginning of your upkeep, unless you pay {B}{B}{B}, tap Demonic Hordes and sacrifice a land of an opponent's choice.
card.flavor: Created to destroy Dominiaria, demons can sometimes be bent to a more focused purpose.

card.name: Demonic Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You pick a card on resolution.
10/4/2004 : You do not show the card you pick out of your library to your opponent.
10/4/2004 : This is not a draw.

card.name: Detonate
card.ability: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

card.name: Devastation
card.ability: Destroy all creatures and lands.
card.flavor: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

card.name: Diabolic Machine
card.ability: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.
card.flavor:
"The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning."
—Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

card.name: Divine Offering
card.ability: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, you do not gain any life.
6/1/2011 : If Divine Offering resolves, but the artifact regenerates or is indestructible, you'll still gain the life.

card.name: Dragon Engine
card.ability: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

card.name: Drain Power
card.ability: Target player activates a mana ability of each land he or she controls. Then put all mana from that player's mana pool into yours.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This card forces the target player to draw mana from lands if they are untapped, but that player can choose how to draw the mana if a land he or she controls has multiple mana abilities, or mana abilities with choices.
10/4/2004 : Since this is a Sorcery, your opponent may use Instants and abilities of permanents in response to this spell before you get the mana from their mana pool and lands.
10/4/2004 : If a land can draw a variable amount of mana, the target player (not the player of this spell) chooses how much to draw.
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that doesn't target and could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

card.name: Dread Reaper
card.ability:
Flying
When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

card.name: Dread Wight
card.ability: At end of combat, put a paralyzation counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Dread Wight and tap those creatures. Each of those creatures doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as it has a paralyzation counter on it. Each of those creatures gains "{4}: Remove a paralyzation counter from this creature."

card.name: Drop of Honey
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy the creature with the least power. It can't be regenerated. If two or more creatures are tied for least power, you choose one of them.
When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Drop of Honey.
card.ruling:
7/15/2006 : This card's ability is not targeted, so even untargetable creatures or those with Protection can be chosen.
2/1/2007 : If the creature with the least power is indestructible, the ability does nothing.
2/1/2007 : If there are multiple creatures tied for least power and some but not all of them are indestructible, the indestructible ones can't be chosen.

card.name: Drowned
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Drowned.
card.flavor: We asked Captain Soll what became of the Serafina, but all he said was, "Ships that go down shouldn't come back up."

card.name: Dust to Dust
card.ability: Exile two target artifacts.
card.flavor:
"All this nonsense made by mages Rusts and crumbles through the ages."
—Aline Corralurn, "Inheritance"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If one target is removed or becomes invalid after declaration, the other target is still affected.

card.name: Ebon Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
When Ebon Dragon enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent discard a card.

card.name: Ebony Horse
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

card.name: Ebony Rhino
card.ability: Trample
card.flavor:
"That Rhino would fetch us a tidy sum, Joven. Perhaps it's time to make it ours."
—Chandler

card.name: Elephant Graveyard
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Regenerate target Elephant.

card.name: Elite Cat Warrior
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: "Hear that? No? That's a cat warrior."

card.name: Energy Flux
card.ability: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."

card.name: Eye for an Eye
card.ability: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : The damage dealt to you is still being dealt by the original source. The damage dealt to the other player is being dealt by Eye for an Eye.
2/1/2009 : Eye for an Eye must resolve before damage would be dealt to you in order to affect that damage.

card.name: False Summoning
card.ability: Counter target creature spell.

card.name: Fastbond
card.ability:
You may play any number of additional lands on each of your turns.
Whenever you play a land, if it wasn't the first land you played this turn, Fastbond deals 1 damage to you.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You take damage when you play a land using the "play a land" action. Such an action can be your regular "play a land", one enabled by Fastbond, or ones enabled through other effects.
10/4/2004 : You do not take damage when you "put a land onto the battlefield" through the effect of a spell or ability.

card.name: Fire Imp
card.ability: When Fire Imp enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

card.name: Fire Tempest
card.ability: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

card.name: Fireball
card.ability:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
card.ruling:
12/1/2004 : The additional cost is paid when you pay the rest of Fireball's costs, even though that text appears second on the card (to make the card easier to read). The additional cost doesn't count toward Fireball's converted mana cost.
12/1/2004 : If, for example, X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R}). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
5/1/2009 : You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
10/1/2009 : Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal at that time.
10/1/2009 : You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

card.name: Floodwater Dam
card.ability: {X}{X}{1}, {T}: Tap X target lands.
card.flavor: Viscerid dams may be of living creatures as well as bones and mud.

card.name: Flying Carpet
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Fog
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Fog has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

card.name: Force of Nature
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

card.name: Fork
card.ability: Copy target instant or sorcery spell, except that the copy is red. You may choose new targets for the copy.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : When a spell with additional costs is copied, you don't have to pay those costs again.
10/4/2004 : For spells that can have a variable number of targets, the controller of the copy must use the same number of targets the original spell did.
10/4/2004 : Forking a spell with an X in the cost requires you to use the same X value.
10/4/2004 : Fork will not copy changes made by modifying effects to the spell prior to the use of Fork, such as text-changing effects.
10/4/2004 : If mana or other costs need to be spent at resolution of the spell, the player of Fork would still be responsible for paying that cost.
10/4/2004 : You need not (and may not) pay any additional mana or other costs (like sacrifices) to use the spell which is Forked. You get control over a complete copy but can change nothing except the targets.
10/4/2004 : Fork does not let you make non-targeting choices about the spell.
10/4/2004 : If the spell being copied targets a spell on the stack, it is possible to target Fork itself since Fork is still on the stack when you pick the target(s) for the copy. Note that the copy's target will be illegal when it resolves.
10/4/2004 : If you copy a spell for which Buyback has been paid, you get nothing back since the copied spell does not have a card to give you.
10/4/2004 : The copy that is placed on the stack is not considered to have been "cast".
10/4/2004 : The Fork card goes to the graveyard when it resolves and leaves the copy on the stack. There is no card representing the copy on the stack.
10/4/2004 : It does copy the mana symbols in the mana cost for the card it is copying, but it uses its own color definition and not the one from those mana symbols. This is so it maintains its color just like the text says.
12/1/2004 : If you Fork a Spliced spell, the spliced text is added during the announcement of the original spell, and therefore is fully copied by Fork.
5/1/2009 : The copy will have the same mana cost as the original spell, but will be red rather than whatever color that mana cost would have made it.
10/1/2009 : If the targeted spell was kicked, then the copy will be kicked as well. If the targeted spell was not kicked, then the copy will not be kicked.

card.name: Foul Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
When Foul Spirit enters the battlefield, sacrifice a land.

card.name: Gaea's Avenger
card.ability: Gaea's Avenger's power and toughness are each equal to 1 plus the number of artifacts your opponents control.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : In multi-player games it counts artifacts of all opponents.

card.name: Gate to Phyrexia
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.
card.flavor:
"The warm rain of grease on my face immediately made it clear I had entered Phyrexia."
—Jarsyl, Diary

card.name: Gauntlet of Might
card.ability:
Red creatures get +1/+1.
Whenever a Mountain is tapped for mana, its controller adds {R} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Dual lands which have Mountain as one of their types produce an extra red mana when tapped for either color.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.ability: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Tortoise
card.ability: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

card.name: Glasses of Urza
card.ability: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

card.name: Gloom
card.ability:
White spells cost {3} more to cast.
Activated abilities of white enchantments cost {3} more to activate.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The extra mana is not considered part of the activation cost. It is a separate cost.
10/4/2004 : The additional mana is paid at the same time the spell/ability is cast/activated.
10/4/2004 : The extra mana is part of the total cost, so cost reducers can be applied to this cost.

card.name: Goblin Bully
card.flavor: It's easy to stand head and shoulders over those with no backbone.

card.name: Goblin Cavaliers
card.flavor: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

card.name: Goblin Caves
card.ability:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +0/+2.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Works even if placed on one of your opponent's Mountains.
10/4/2004 : Works if enchanting a Snow-Covered Mountain.

card.name: Goblin Firestarter
card.ability: Sacrifice Goblin Firestarter: Goblin Firestarter deals 1 damage to target creature or player. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.

card.name: Goblin General
card.ability: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Lead, follow, or run like crazy.

card.name: Goblin Shrine
card.ability:
Enchant land
As long as enchanted land is a basic Mountain, Goblin creatures get +1/+0.
When Goblin Shrine leaves the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to each Goblin creature.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Works even if placed on one of your opponent's Mountains.

card.name: Goblin Warrens
card.ability: {2}{R}, Sacrifice two Goblins: Put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"Goblins bred underground, their numbers hidden from the enemy until it was too late."
—Sarpadian Empires, vol. IV
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The token Goblins can be sacrificed to the Warrens to generate new Goblins.

card.name: Gorilla War Cry
card.ability:
Cast Gorilla War Cry only during combat before blockers are declared.
Creatures can't be blocked this turn except by two or more creatures.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Grapeshot Catapult
card.ability: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
card.flavor: For years scholars debated whether these were Urza's or Mishra's creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers' original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.

card.name: Gravebind
card.ability:
Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

card.name: Guardian Beast
card.ability: As long as Guardian Beast is untapped, noncreature artifacts you control can't be enchanted, they're indestructible, and other players can't gain control of them. This effect doesn't remove Auras already attached to those artifacts.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This does not stop sacrifices.

card.name: Harsh Justice
card.ability:
Cast Harsh Justice only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
This turn, whenever an attacking creature deals combat damage to you, it deals that much damage to its controller.

card.name: Hasran Ogress
card.ability: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You either take damage or pay the 2 mana during resolution.

card.name: Healing Salve
card.ability: Choose one — Target player gains 3 life; or prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

card.name: Horn of Deafening
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
card.flavor: "A blast, an echo . . . then silence."

card.name: Howl from Beyond
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Ice Cauldron
card.ability:
{X}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Ice Cauldron and exile a nonland card from your hand. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled. Note the type and amount of mana spent to pay this activation cost. Activate this ability only if there are no charge counters on Ice Cauldron.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Ice Cauldron: Add Ice Cauldron's last noted type and amount of mana to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast the last card exiled with Ice Cauldron.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The Cauldron counts only mana spent on it. It doesn't see the value of X, so isn't affected by cost reductions. Thus, if you spent {2}{R}{R} on X, you get {2}{R}{R} later even if X was 6.
10/4/2004 : Cards which are not actually in your hand can't be exiled by the Ice Cauldron.
10/4/2004 : If multiple cards are exiled by the Cauldron, the mana can only be used for the card that was exiled by the Cauldron when the most recent charge counter was put there.
10/4/2004 : The mana put in the Cauldron can only be used to cast the given spell, but you can add additional mana to a spell. This means you can pay part of the cost on one turn and the rest of it on the next turn.
10/4/2004 : You do not have to use any mana from the Cauldron when casting the spell if you don't want to. You don't even have to tap the Cauldron and draw the mana, you can just cast the spell using mana from somewhere else.
10/4/2004 : If multiple cards are exiled by the Cauldron, any one of them can be cast.
10/4/2004 : If the ability to exile a card with the Cauldron is countered, you do not lose the card since it is exiled during resolution.
10/4/2004 : It is possible to have more than one card exiled by the Cauldron. You can tap the Cauldron to remove the charge counter and whatever mana is on it but leave the card there. Later, you can tap it and put in mana and a charge counter to add another card.
10/4/2004 : X can be zero. This places a zero mana counter on the Cauldron.
10/4/2004 : You can only cast the spell when you could legally cast it normally. So no casting a Sorcery on your opponent's turn.
10/4/2004 : The mana can be used to pay for additional costs to cast the spell.
10/4/2004 : If the Cauldron leaves the battlefield, you can still cast any cards it exiled as though they were in your hand. You just no longer have access to the mana you charged the Cauldron with.
10/4/2004 : Tapping the Cauldron for the mana is a mana ability.
10/4/2004 : Produces mana of the last type used to put a counter on itself, not via any other charge counters.

card.name: Icy Manipulator
card.ability: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Tapping a card with an effect like this will never pay the cost of an ability. For example, tapping a land with this card will not put mana into a player's pool.
10/4/2004 : Icy Manipulator can't be used to stop someone from using an ability of the permanent you plan to tap. It can be used to make a player use the ability now or to not use it.
10/4/2004 : The ability can target a tapped card, but tapping a tapped card does nothing useful. And it will not trigger "if the card becomes tapped" effects.
10/4/2004 : If you want to stop someone from attacking with a creature by using this card, you must do so before attackers are declared. You can't wait until after attackers are declared and then try to use it to make a creature stop attacking. Note that your opponent can't start declaring attackers without letting you use the Icy Manipulator.
10/4/2004 : Tapping an attacking creature which did not tap to attack does not remove the creature from the attack or cause the creature to stop dealing damage.

card.name: In the Eye of Chaos
card.ability: Whenever a player casts an instant spell, counter it unless that player pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This ability triggers when the spell is cast.
10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Instill Energy
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If attached to an opponent's creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
10/4/2004 : Instill Energy's untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.
8/1/2005 : Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card's ability to untap once during the turn.

card.name: Ironhoof Ox
card.ability: Ironhoof Ox can't be blocked by more than one creature.
card.flavor: The good news is it's vegetarian. The bad news is it just doesn't like you.

card.name: Island Sanctuary
card.ability: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you get multiple draws or you use a spell or ability during the draw step to draw extra cards, you can have the replacement effect apply to any one or all of those. You need only have it apply once to get the effect. If you skip more than one, there is no additional effect.
10/4/2004 : If the replacement effect is applied, the effect will continue until your next turn even if this card leaves the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : Since the draw is replaced, you can't use the same draw to do other things.

card.name: Jade Monolith
card.ability: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

card.name: Juggernaut
card.ability:
Juggernaut attacks each turn if able.
Juggernaut can't be blocked by Walls.
card.flavor: We had taken refuge in a small cave, thinking the entrance was too narrow for it to follow. To our horror, its gigantic head smashed into the mountainside, ripping itself a new entrance.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : An effect that states "Enchanted creature can only be blocked by Walls" will make the Juggernaut unblockable. The "can only be blocked by walls" effect doesn't override the text on the Juggernaut's ability.
10/4/2004 : There is no penalty if for some reason the Juggernaut can't attack, but if it can attack you must do so.
8/15/2010 : If, during your declare attackers step, Juggernaut is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or is affected by "summoning sickness," then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having Juggernaut attack, you aren't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.
8/15/2010 : If there are multiple combat phases in a turn, Juggernaut must attack only in the first one in which it's able to.

card.name: Junún Efreet
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

card.name: Just Fate
card.ability:
Cast Just Fate only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Destroy target attacking creature.

card.name: Kismet
card.ability: Artifacts, creatures, and lands played by your opponents enter the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor:
"Make people wait for what they want, and you have power over them. This is as true for merchants and militia as it is for cooks and couples."
—Gwendlyn Di Corci
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : Cards enter the battlefield tapped. They do not enter the battlefield untapped and then immediately tap, therefore they do not trigger any effects due to tapping.
2/1/2007 : It affects all opponents.
2/1/2007 : Does not affect cards that phase in.

card.name: Kormus Bell
card.ability: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The lands are both lands and creatures at the same time. They are affected by anything that affects either permanent type.
10/4/2004 : It affects Swamps controlled by any and all players.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Kudzu
card.ability:
Enchant land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it. That land's controller attaches Kudzu to a land of his or her choice.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can move it to any other player's land whenever you get to move it.
8/1/2005 : If Kudzu is destroyed directly, or the land is destroyed by a spell or ability, then Kudzu goes to the graveyard like any Aura would.
4/1/2008 : The controller of the destroyed land must attach it to another land if possible. If there are no valid choices, Kudzu is simply put into the graveyard.
4/1/2008 : Because the ability isn't targeted, the controller of the destroyed land may attach it to a land that can't be the target of abilities.

card.name: Last Chance
card.ability: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

card.name: Lava Flow
card.ability: Destroy target creature or land.

card.name: Leeches
card.ability: Target player loses all poison counters. Leeches deals that much damage to that player.
card.flavor:
"Where our potions and powders fail, perhaps nature will succeed."
—Reyhan, Samite Alchemist

card.name: Library of Alexandria
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you have exactly seven cards in hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You may tap multiples of these in response to each other because the requirement for 7 cards is checked only at the time the ability is announced and not again when it resolves.

card.name: Library of Leng
card.ability:
You have no maximum hand size.
If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This effect has no effect on the cards being put into the graveyard from a library, because they are not "discarded".
10/4/2004 : You can't use the Library of Leng ability to place a discarded card on top of your library when you discard a card as a cost, because costs aren't effects.
10/4/2004 : The discard triggers anything else that triggers on discards.
10/4/2004 : You can look at a randomly discarded card before deciding where it goes.
10/4/2004 : The ability applies any time a spell or ability has you discard as part of its effect. It does not matter if you or your opponent control the spell or ability. The discard is forced because it is an effect.
10/4/2004 : If more than one card is discarded due to a single effect, the Library allows you to decide whether or not to use it on each of the cards. You get to decide the order the cards are placed on the library if more than one goes there.
10/4/2004 : Since the card goes directly to the library, the card is not revealed unless the spell or ability requiring the discard specifically says it is.
10/4/2004 : The ability replaces the normal discard action with a discard action that puts the card on the library instead of the graveyard.
10/1/2009 : If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Library of Leng onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

card.name: Lich
card.ability:
As Lich enters the battlefield, you lose life equal to your life total.
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
If you would gain life, draw that many cards instead.
Whenever you're dealt damage, sacrifice that many nontoken permanents. If you can't, you lose the game.
When Lich is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you lose the game.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you have multiple Lich cards on the battlefield, you must sacrifice a permanent for each damage done to you for each Lich. This is because the sacrifice is a triggered ability. But you only draw one card for each life gained regardless of how many Liches you have. This is because the draw is a replacement effect and not a triggered one. You lose if any one of the Liches leaves the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : If you take more than one damage at a time, sacrifice the permanents for that damage simultaneously. This allows you to sacrifice both a creature and any Aura that is on it all at once.
10/4/2004 : You can't pay life, just like any player at less than one life can't pay life. You can pay zero life if you want.
10/4/2004 : If an opponent steals control of Lich and no other effect prevents you from losing with a life total of zero, you will lose the game due to a zero life total as a State-Based Action before you can take any actions. The last sentence doesn't apply in this case since the Lich didn't leave the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : If an opponent steals control of Lich, their life total does not change. The life total changes for a player only when it enters the battlefield under that player's control.
10/4/2004 : You can lose life and take damage, and thereby have a negative life total, while Lich is on the battlefield.
8/15/2010 : The last ability will cause you to lose the game even if you somehow manage to have a life-total greater than 0 at the time the Lich leaves the battlefield or if some other effect would prevent you from losing for having 0 life. If, on the other hand, some effect such as that from Platinum Angel says that you can't lose the game then even the last ability of the Lich cannot cause you to do so. The ability will just resolve and the game will continue as normal.
8/15/2010 : Note that usually you will have 0 or less life at the time Lich leaves the battlefield causing you to lose as a State-Based Action before the last ability can even go on the stack.
1/1/2011 : The last ability will cause you to lose the game even if you somehow manage to have a life-total greater than 0 at the time the Lich is put into the graveyard or if some other effect would prevent you from losing for having 0 life. If, on the other hand, some effect such as that from Platinum Angel says that you can't lose the game then even the last ability of the Lich cannot cause you to do so. The ability will just resolve and the game will continue as normal.

card.name: Lifeforce
card.ability: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.

card.name: Lim-Dûl's Cohort
card.ability: Whenever Lim-Dûl's Cohort blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature can't be regenerated this turn.

card.name: Living Lands
card.ability: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Living Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Regenerate Living Wall.
card.flavor: Some fiendish mage had created a horrifying wall of living flesh, patched together from a jumble of still-recognizable body parts. As we sought to hew our way through it, some unknown power healed the gaping wounds we cut, denying us passage.

card.name: Mahamoti Djinn
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: Of royal blood amongst the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

card.name: Mana Matrix
card.ability: Instant and enchantment spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Multiple Matrices are cumulative. Two will reduce the cost by up to {4}, and so on.
10/4/2004 : Only affects its controller, not all players.
10/4/2004 : Only works on Instants and enchantments. It does not work on sorceries.
10/4/2004 : Only reduces the generic mana portion of a spell's cost. If the cost does not include generic mana or includes less than {2}, you get a reduced or null effect from this card.

card.name: Mana Vault
card.ability:
Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault.
At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.
{T}: Add {3} to your mana pool.

card.name: Martyr's Cry
card.ability: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.
card.flavor:
"It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge."
—Vervamon the Elder
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Only affects creatures on the battlefield, not ones in hands or graveyards.

card.name: Martyrs of Korlis
card.ability: As long as Martyrs of Korlis is untapped, all damage that would be dealt to you by artifacts is dealt to Martyrs of Korlis instead.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you have multiple Martyrs of Korlis, you can decide which one receives the redirected damage each time artifact damage would be dealt to you.

card.name: Maze of Ith
card.ability: {T}: Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Can target an untapped attacking creature. Both parts of the effect will try to happen even if one part does nothing useful. So if it tries to untap an already untapped card, it will still make the creature neither deal nor receive damage.
10/4/2004 : The creature is still part of the combat. It just has its damage prevented. Don't infer something from the fact that it becomes untapped.

card.name: Mightstone
card.ability: Attacking creatures get +1/+0.
card.flavor: While exploring the sacred cave of Koilos with his brother Mishra and their master Tocasia, Urza fell behind in the Hall of Tagsin, where he discovered the remarkable Mightstone.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The +1/+0 applies to attacking creatures from all players.

card.name: Mijae Djinn
card.ability: Whenever Mijae Djinn attacks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, remove Mijae Djinn from combat and tap it.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The coin flip is done as a triggered ability on declaring the Djinn as an attacker.
10/4/2004 : If the Djinn attacks, but you lose the coin toss, then it is still considered to have attacked, and any other abilities that trigger on it attacking will resolve normally.
10/4/2004 : Any abilities which have already resolved before the coin flip are not undone. Any abilities that trigger when it attacks which have not already resolved will still resolve.

card.name: Minion of Tevesh Szat
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Minion of Tevesh Szat deals 2 damage to you unless you pay {B}{B}.
{T}: Target creature gets +3/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"A minion given over to Tevesh Szat is a stronger minion gained."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

card.name: Mishra's Workshop
card.ability: {T}: Add {3} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells.
card.flavor: Though he eventually came to despise Tocasia, Mishra listened well to her lessons on clarity of purpose. Unlike his brother, he focused his mind on a single goal.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You can spend the mana on costs on the spell's text.
10/4/2004 : The mana can't be used to pay Echo costs.
10/4/2004 : This mana may not be used to pay costs imposed after the spell is initially cast.
10/4/2004 : This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.

card.name: Mystic Decree
card.ability: All creatures lose flying and islandwalk.
card.flavor:
"Curse Reveka, and curse her coddled conjurers. Their sorcerers' school shall yet be ours."
—Irini Sengir
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Naked Singularity
card.ability:
Cumulative upkeep {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
If tapped for mana, Plains produce {R}, Islands produce {G}, Swamps produce {W}, Mountains produce {U}, and Forests produce {B} instead of any other type.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability generates a replacement effect.
10/4/2004 : If a player uses a text-changing effect to make a land type be listed as producing two different colors, the player tapping the land for mana can choose to produce mana of either color. But if it produces more than one mana, all mana is of the same color.
4/15/2013 : If a land has more than one basic land type, the player tapping the land for mana can choose to produce mana of either color. But if it produces more than one mana, all mana is of the same color.

card.name: Oasis
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

card.name: Obelisk of Undoing
card.ability: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you both own and control to your hand.
card.flavor: The Battle of Tomakul taught Urza not to rely on fickle reinforcements.

card.name: Obsianus Golem
card.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . ."
—"Song of the Artificer"

card.name: Ogre Taskmaster
card.ability: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
card.flavor: Three little goblins, enjoying their brew. One bumped an ogre, and then there were two.

card.name: Onulet
card.ability: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

card.name: Orcish Mechanics
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice an artifact: Orcish Mechanics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Osai Vultures
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.
Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Only gets one counter per turn, not one per creature.

card.name: Overwhelming Forces
card.ability: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.

card.name: Owl Familiar
card.ability:
Flying
When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

card.name: Pentagram of the Ages
card.ability: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: "Take this item, for instance. How would it destroy us, Relicbane?" —Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

card.name: Personal Incarnation
card.ability:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Any player may activate this ability, but only if he or she owns Personal Incarnation.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half his or her life, rounded up.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
10/4/2004 : The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent's Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
2/1/2007 : If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0.  This means that the life total stays the same.  A life total of -10 would remain -10.

card.name: Phantasmal Forces
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
card.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

card.name: Phantasmal Terrain
card.ability:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
card.ruling: 10/15/2006 : Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

card.name: Planar Gate
card.ability: Creature spells you cast cost up to {2} less to cast.
card.flavor: Nireya reached through the Gate, sensing the energies trapped beyond.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Multiple Gates are cumulative. Two will reduce the cost by up to {4}, and so on.
10/4/2004 : Only works for its controller, not all players.
10/4/2004 : Only reduces the generic mana portion of a spell's cost. If the cost does not include generic mana or includes less than {2}, you get a reduced or null effect from this card.
4/1/2008 : Works on all spells with the type Creature, even if the spell has another type like Artifact or Enchantment.

card.name: Plateau
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Power Artifact
card.ability:
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact's activated abilities cost {2} less to activate. This effect can't reduce the amount of mana an ability costs to activate to less than one mana.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Only affects the generic mana part of activation costs. Colored parts of mana costs are not affected.
10/4/2004 : Can be placed on artifacts with no or zero activation costs, but this has no effect on them. It does not increase the cost to one.
7/15/2006 : Can’t reduce Snow mana costs.

card.name: Primal Clay
card.ability: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)
card.ruling:
7/1/2012 : In zones other than the battlefield, Primal Clay is 0/0.
7/1/2012 : If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of Primal Clay, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won't necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
7/1/2012 : If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of Primal Clay, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for Primal Clay when it entered the battlefield.

card.name: Primitive Justice
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Primitive Justice, you may pay {1}{R} and/or {1}{G} any number of times.
Destroy target artifact. For each additional {1}{R} you paid, destroy another target artifact. For each additional {1}{G} you paid, destroy another target artifact, and you gain 1 life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : can't target the same artifact more than once, even with different parts of the spell.

card.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
card.ability: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

card.name: Prowling Nightstalker
card.ability: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by black creatures.
card.flavor: Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.

card.name: Radjan Spirit
card.ability: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can be used on a creature without Flying with no effect.

card.name: Rain of Daggers
card.ability: Destroy all creatures target opponent controls. You lose 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.
card.flavor: Knives in the sky, cries in the air, and blood on the ground.

card.name: Rakalite
card.ability: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Return Rakalite to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: Urza was the first to understand that the war would not be lost for lack of power, but for lack of troops.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Only returns to your hand if it is still on the battlefield at the end of the turn. If it leaves the battlefield, it does not return.
10/4/2004 : Can be used any number of times during the turn before it leaves the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : Can choose a different creature or player for each use.

card.name: Reconstruction
card.ability: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

card.name: Red Elemental Blast
card.ability: Choose one — Counter target blue spell; or destroy target blue permanent.

card.name: Regrowth
card.ability: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Righteous Charge
card.ability: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.
card.ruling: 1/24/2013 : Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

card.name: Ring of Renewal
card.ability: {5}, {T}: Discard a card at random, then draw two cards.
card.flavor: To the uninitiated, the Ring of Renewal is merely an oddity. For those fluent in the wielding of magic, however, it is a source of great knowledge.

card.name: Roc of Kher Ridges
card.ability: Flying

card.name: Rock Hydra
card.ability:
Rock Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
For each 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra, if it has a +1/+1 counter on it, remove a +1/+1 counter from it and prevent that 1 damage.
{R}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Rock Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If put onto the battlefield without casting it from your hand, X will be zero.
10/4/2004 : Once on the battlefield, the X is considered to be zero when calculating its mana cost.
8/1/2008 : You can activate the activated ability that prevents damage any time, even if no source seems likely to deal damage to you in the near future. It will prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt this turn, even if that turns out to be much later in the turn.
8/1/2008 : If damage that would be dealt to Rock Hydra can't be prevented, you still remove a +1/+1 counter from it for each 1 damage dealt.

card.name: Rockslide Ambush
card.ability: Rockslide Ambush deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

card.name: Sandstorm
card.ability: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
card.flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

card.name: Savannah
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Savannah Lions
card.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless flat plains of their homeland.

card.name: Scarecrow
card.ability: {6}, {T}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by creatures with flying.
card.flavor: There was more malice in its button eyes than should have been possible in something that had never known life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Even prevents non-combat damage from flying creatures.

card.name: Scarwood Bandits
card.ability:
Forestwalk
{2}{G}, {T}: Unless an opponent pays {2}, gain control of target artifact for as long as Scarwood Bandits remains on the battlefield.

card.name: Scavenger Folk
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.

card.name: Scavenging Ghoul
card.ability:
At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn.
Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The Ghoul still gets to claim counters even if it enters the battlefield after the creatures died.

card.name: Scrubland
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Sea Serpent
card.ability:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
card.flavor: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

card.name: Sedge Troll
card.ability:
Sedge Troll gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Swamp.
{B}: Regenerate Sedge Troll.
card.flavor: The stench in the hovel was overpowering; something loathsome was cooking. Occasionally something surfaced in the thick paste, but my host would casually push it down before I could make out what it was.

card.name: Sengir Vampire
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
card.ruling:
7/15/2007 : If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.
9/22/2011 : Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
9/22/2011 : If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

card.name: Serendib Djinn
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a land. If you sacrifice an Island this way, Serendib Djinn deals 3 damage to you.
When you control no lands, sacrifice Serendib Djinn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of the land is done during the resolution of the triggered ability. You also choose the land at that time.

card.name: Serra Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
card.flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

card.name: Serra Aviary
card.ability: Creatures with flying get +1/+1.
card.flavor:
"Serra, like Feroz, is long since dead. But remember, Daria: her spirit shall survive so long as the Homelands do."
—Taysir
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : This has the supertype world. This supertype is similar to legendary. The difference is that when a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

card.name: Serra Bestiary
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Serra Bestiary unless you pay {W}{W}.
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Does prevent the use of activated mana abilities with {Tap} in the cost.

card.name: Shapeshifter
card.ability:
As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.
Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : The ability that sets its power and toughness is a characteristic-defining ability. This means it applies before any other effects that modify power and/or toughness.
8/1/2008 : The ability that lets you choose a new number is a triggered ability that triggers only once each upkeep.

card.name: Shivan Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

card.name: Sinkhole
card.ability: Destroy target land.

card.name: Sleight of Hand
card.ability: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

card.name: Smoke
card.ability: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Animated lands are affected by this spell. If on the battlefield with an effect that limits the number of land you untap, untapping an animated land will count as the one creature and the one land you can untap... thereby limiting you to one thing to be untapped.

card.name: Sol Ring
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

card.name: Soldevi Golem
card.ability:
Soldevi Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target tapped creature an opponent controls. If you do, untap Soldevi Golem.
card.flavor: Slow and steady wins the race.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability to untap a creature can be used even if the Golem is already untapped.

card.name: Soldevi Machinist
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to activate abilities of artifacts.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : Mana from the ability can only be spent on activation costs for abilities from artifacts. It can't be spent on artifact spells, or on costs resulting from triggered abilities.

card.name: Soul Shred
card.ability: Soul Shred deals 3 damage to target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.

card.name: Southern Elephant
card.flavor: While defending their southern borders, both the Wu and Shu kingdoms fought against the barbarians' trained elephants.

card.name: Spotted Griffin
card.ability: Flying
card.flavor: When the cat flies and the bird stalks, guard your horses carefully.

card.name: Squall
card.ability: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

card.name: Staff of Zegon
card.ability: {3}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Though Mishra was impressed by the staves Ashnod had created for Zegon's defense, he understood they only hinted at her full potential.

card.name: Stasis
card.ability:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since there is no untap step, Phasing in/out won't happen.
10/4/2004 : Does not prevent cards from being untapped outside the untap step.

card.name: Steam Catapult
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
card.flavor: "You idiots! Turn it around! Turn it around!"

card.name: Strip Mine
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.
card.flavor: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.

card.name: Swords to Plowshares
card.ability: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the creature has a negative power, the player does not lose life. It acts the same as if it had a power of zero.
10/1/2008 : The amount of life that's gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

card.name: Sylvan Tutor
card.ability: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Symbol of Unsummoning
card.ability:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: ". . . inviting the soul to wander for a spell in abysses of solitude . . . ." —Kate Chopin, The Awakening

card.name: Tablet of Epityr
card.ability: Whenever an artifact you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Originally considered the work of Urza, this tablet was created by forgers seeking to imitate Urza's masterpieces.

card.name: Taiga
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
10/1/2008 : This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

card.name: Talas Researcher
card.ability: {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only during your turn, before attackers are declared.
card.flavor:
From time, knowledge.
From knowledge, power.

card.name: Tawnos's Wand
card.ability: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

card.name: Tawnos's Weaponry
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.
card.flavor: When Urza's war machines became too costly, Tawnos's weaponry replaced them.

card.name: Temple Acolyte
card.ability: When Temple Acolyte enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor: Young, yes. Inexperienced, yes. Weak? Don't count on it.

card.name: Terror
card.ability: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Tetravus
card.ability:
Flying
Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, put that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted."
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens put onto the battlefield with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the Tetravus is destroyed when the Tetravites are off the card, they are not destroyed, they are just orphaned.
10/4/2004 : Any +1/+1 counter which is on this card can be turned into a Tetravite token. It does not care where the +1/+1 counter came from.
